title: Voltage Stability
description: The ability of a power system to maintain steady voltages close to nominal value.

sections.title: Definition in an Article by a Task Force
sections.body_md: > Voltage stability refers to the ability of a power system to maintain steady voltages close to nominal value at all buses in the system after being subjected to a disturbance.

sections.title: Definition in a European Union Regulation
sections.body_md: > 'voltage stability' means the ability of a transmission system to maintain acceptable voltages at all nodes in the transmission system in the N-situation and after being subjected to a disturbance;
